title: Building a Dakota Fire Hole
brief: Construct a concealed underground fireplace with proper ventilation for cooking and warmth.
steps: Step 1: Dig a main hole in the ground about 30 centimeters deep and 25 centimeters wide.
Step 2: On the upwind side, dig a second connecting hole at an angle toward the main hole for ventilation.
Step 3: Make the ventilation tunnel connect to the bottom of the main fire hole.
Step 4: Build your fire in the main hole using normal fire-building techniques.
Step 5: The ventilation tunnel will provide airflow to keep the fire burning efficiently.
warnings: Ensure adequate ventilation or fire will not burn properly and may produce dangerous carbon monoxide.
Be careful not to cave in the tunnel while digging.
Still clear flammable material from around the hole entrance.
